permafrost.tundra.lang

Class StringHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • permafrost.tundra.lang.StringHelper

  • public class StringHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of convenience methods for working with String objects.

        pattern - The regular expression pattern.

        pattern - The literal of regular expression pattern.
        literal - Whether the pattern is a literal pattern or a regular expression.
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A regular expression pattern which literally matches the given string.

      • quote

        public static java.lang.String quote(java.lang.String[] array)
        Returns a regular expression pattern that matches any of the values in the given string list.
        Parameters:
        array - The list of strings to be matched.
        Returns:
        A regular expression which literally matches any of the given strings.

      • pad

        public static java.lang.String pad(java.lang.String string,
                                   int length,
                                   char character)
        Pads a string with the given character to the given length.
        Parameters:
        string - The string to pad.
        length - The desired length of the string. If less than 0 the string is padded right to left, otherwise it is padded from left to right.
        character - The character to pad the string with.
        Returns:
        The padded string.

      • compare

        public static int compare(java.lang.String string1,
                          java.lang.String string2,
                          boolean caseInsensitive)
        Compares two strings lexicographically.
        Parameters:
        string1 - The first string to compare.
        string2 - The second string to compare.
        caseInsensitive - Whether the comparison should be case insensitive.
        Returns:
        Less than 0 if the first string is less than the second string, equal to 0 if the two strings are equal, or greater than 0 if the first string is greater than the second string.
